summary: This is an email chain forwarding Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures from her defense team to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It shows the procedural exchange of discovery materials in the criminal case against Maxwell.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Sends the email attaching Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 16 disclosures on behalf of the defense law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Requested that the Rule 16 disclosures be sent to the prosecution in the U.S. v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email containing Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 16 disclosures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (U.S. v. Maxwell, 20Cr330) for which her defense team is submitting Rule 16 disclosures.

persons.name: Ryan Hall
persons.context: Mentioned in a note about a brief due on Monday, 11/15, likely in relation to the case.

connections.description: Pagliuca is a defense attorney requesting the submission of Maxwell's Rule 16 disclosures, indicating he is part of her legal team.
Menninger is copied on the disclosure email as part of Maxwell's defense counsel.
Simmons sends the disclosures at Pagliuca's request, indicating they work together at the same law firm.
Both are part of the defense team from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., working on Maxwell's case.

events.title: Brief Deadline
events.description: A brief is due, as noted in the email, likely related to the ongoing U.S. v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Submission of Rule 16 Disclosures
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team submits her Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures to the prosecution.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including attorneys Jeffrey Pagliuca and Laura Menninger, submitted her Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures to the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The document is part of the discovery process in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell, 20Cr330 (AJN).
The email chain indicates ongoing legal proceedings and deadlines, such as a brief due on November 15, 2021.
The correspondence is between the defense law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document is a procedural record showing the exchange of required legal materials in a high-profile case.
